summary: This is a declaration filed in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons. A BOP staff attorney corrects a prior declaration, clarifying that a log book from the Metropolitan Correctional Center shows a phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2020, not a visitor he received on that date.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center whose phone call on July 30, 2020, is the subject of the corrected record in this FOIA case.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call Logged
events.description: A phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein from the Metropolitan Correctional Center was recorded in an Intake Screening Phone Log.

events.title: Initial Declaration Filed
events.description: A declaration was submitted in the FOIA case that incorrectly described a log book as showing a visitor for Epstein on July 30, 2020.

events.title: Corrective Declaration Filed
events.description: This declaration was executed to correct the record, stating the log actually showed a phone call made by Epstein, not a visit received.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a corrective declaration in a FOIA lawsuit (The New York Times Company v. Federal Bureau of Prisons).
It corrects a prior statement that a log book showed a visitor for Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2020.
The corrected information is that the log book (an Intake Screening Phone Log) actually shows a phone call made by Epstein on that date.
The declaration is submitted in support of the BOP's motion for summary judgment in the FOIA case.
